results.title: Chaucer and the Medieval Period
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English Literature”.
Provides a background for the study of medieval English literature. Identifies the early literary forms - the ballad, mystery play, allegory and romance - and shows how each of these was an expression of different aspects of medieval society. Re-enactments of portions of the Canterbury Tales; Piers Plowman; Sir Gawain and the Green Knight; Morte d’Arthur, illustrate the variety and vigor with which medieval literature is endowed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Chaucer's England with a special presentation of the Pardoner's Tale
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A dramatization of part of the Prologue to Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales and the Pardoner’s Tale. Evokes the life and characters of the time, and gives some details of Chaucer’s career and experiences, before going on to show the Pardoner himself. The narration and dialogue of the Prologue and the Pardoner’s Tale are given in a modern English translation which retains much of the metre and rhyme patterns of the original. Short passages are quoted in both the original Middle English and modern English.

results.title: Chasing lizards
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Alan Mitchell
results.brief_description: Threatening nightmares plague a young man who is still disturbed by an uncomfortable incident in his childhood. With the encouragement of his lover he locates his would-be assailant, searching for an end to his depressive madness.

results.title: Chasing Buddha
results.creator_credit: Go>Group, Halo, SBS Independent, Film Victoria, Amiel Courtin-Wilson and Julie Stone
results.brief_description: Compelling and informative, “Chasing Buddha” is a biographical documentary about Robina Courtin, a highly energetic, outrageous, radical feminist, lesbian Australian Buddhist nun. Born one of seven children and raised as a Catholic, Robina candidly tells of her journey from childhood through to her teens and adult life and of the uncontained energy that drove her into becoming a political activist and radical feminist during the 70s, and finally the “accidental” path which lead her to Buddhism and to her Llama. Loud, enigmatic, charismatic, this amazing woman spends most of her time in the United States where she runs an international magazine, Mandala, teaches and councils students in Buddhism and visits prisoners on life sentences or on death row offering them spiritual guidance and the teachings of Buddha. Totally committed in her beliefs but not afraid to be outspoken or even confrontational, Robina has won the hearts of many and is highly respected wherever she goes. Includes narratives by family and friends, stills, home movies and archival footage. Director Amiel Courtin-Wilson, Robina’s nephew, was nominated in the AFI Awards (2000) for Best Direction in a Documentary.

results.title: Chasing Amy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Scott Mosier, View Askew Productions, Miramax Films and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: The concluding chapter of Kevin Smith’s New Jersey Trilogy, “Chasing Amy” is a comedy about Holden, a successful comic-book creator, whose life takes a turn when he falls madly in love with Alyssa, a fellow artist. The first major shock awaiting Holden is Alyssa’s apparent lesbian orientation. The second one comes after the two develop a strong friendship, and Alyssa decides not to limit her chances of love to women only. The two begin an affair, despite Holden’s nagging doubts about her promiscuous past. Cast includes Ben Affleck, Joey Lauren Adams, Jason Lee, Dwight Ewell, Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith.

results.title: Chase that dream
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Film Australia, Australia. Dept. of Housing and Construction and Ken Cameron
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties faced by low income earners in trying to save money to buy their own home or even rent decent premises. Emphasises how important housing is in people’s lives and how a decision taken at one stage affects their ability to get suitable housing later. Cast includes Laurel McGowan, Peter Fisher, Harry Lawrence, Alan Penney, May Howlett, Gary Files. Credits also include camera; Dean Semler and music; John Gillard.

results.title: Charulata = The Lonely wife
results.creator_credit: R.D. Bansal Productions and Satyajit Ray
results.brief_description:
Calcutta in the 1880s; Charu, the neglected wife of the editor of a political weekly, has an affair with her husband’s cousin, Amal, a young poet. In the detailed observation of a certain stratum of Bengali society, the film oscillates between wryly humorous chamber piece and domestic tragedy as the heroine breaks through to greater self-awareness and understanding of the male domain. Charulata has been described by Ray’s biographer Andrew Robinson as ‘the most complete fusion of eastern and western sensibility in the cinema’, eastern in the specific tensions between the characters, western in the way these tensions are resolved, particularly for Charu. Winner of Silver Bear for Best Direction, Berlin Film Festival. Also available on 16mm.

Credits: Director, writer, music, Satyajit Ray ; photography, Subrata Mitra ; art direction, Bansi Chandragupta ; editor, Dulal Dutta.
Cast: Soumitra Chatterjee, Madhabi Mukherjee, Sailen Mukherjee.
Note: From the novella Nastanirh by Rabindranath Tagore.

results.title: Charting the universe with optical and radio telescopes
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains and illustrates instruments and methods used by astronomers. Describes work of radio astronomers and astrophysicists in search of facts about the universe. Shows cooperation between different observatories in solving mysteries of outer space. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Chart before the course
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Maps and Map Reading”.
We follow the mapmaking process from the first aerial photographs through photogrammetric drawings to the final print stage. Among the points discussed are contour lines, grid references and magnetic variations.

results.title: Charro !
results.creator_credit: National General Pictures and Charles M. Warren
results.brief_description: In Elvis’ 29th film he plays it straight in a Western written and directed by the creator of “Gunsmoke”, “Rawhide” and “The Virginian”. Elvis is cast as ex-outlaw Jess Wade, a man determined to stick to the straight and narrow and reform his ways. Wade is captured by his former band of outlaws. The gang then goes on to terrorise a small town by threatening to use an ornate Mexican canon on the village - a canon which Wade is falsely accused of stealing from the Mexican revolutionary forces. Cast also includes Ina Balin, Victor French, Barbara Werle and Lynn Kellogg. Elvis sings only one song in the movie.
